title: Website Loading as Unsecured, but only in Firefox. Loads with secure certificate on Chrome, Edge and Opera
content:
I'm trying to load https://bfjoy.com/ and only Firefox is redirecting my typing of 'bfjoy.com' as an http: website instead of the correct https:

Why is this? I assume DNS but what is Firefox doing to redirect to the unsecured site that other browsers aren't?

title: Homograph / homoglyph protection?
content: Firefox is notoriously adept when it comes to browser/user protection, (THANK YOU!!!!!!!!). Are there any plans to include protection against homograph/homoglyph attacks please? I think the simplest way would be to just search the URL for any characters that are not part of the current/usual typeset?

title: Themes do not stay locked since several updates back.
content: Themes do not stay locked since several updates back. It is ridiculous that every time you open the browser you need to go to settings and get 'dark theme' back on, when it is the only theme many of us with visual problems can use. MANY people have complained about this (read your own reviews). FIX IT! It's doubtless a five minute job to put this back the way it was.

title: Captcha problem with Firefox and other forks
content:
problem screenshot Hi. I am using 120.0 last version firefox, Windows 11 also last build

When i open normal tab with Yandex search and search something, i get yandex captcha every time

When i open private tab firefox (also waterfox\librefox), i get captcha every search google.com. Change proxy with FoxyProxy fixing problem

Google chrome \ vivaldi \edge \ yandex browser and other chromium browsers doesnt have this problem
creator: demon964

title: Firefox browser version 119.0 experienced suspicious activity
content:
hi Team,

We are working on xxx organization and for one of our core applications experienced suspicious activity since November 22, 2023, while users leveraging Firefox browser version 119.0 where customer made multiple attempts to perform sequence of flow and got dropped. Around 99% of our customer got dropped ever since Nov 22. We are not sure if its due browser or any other suspicious issue. 

however, we would like to understand from your other customer experience perspective, have we encountered any bad user experience using Firefox browser version 119.0 / or do we have any bug encountered and recently had a fix?

2. Another question, If in case was a fix for Firefox version 119.0 will the customer browser automatically gets updated ?

It would be great if you can help us to share these details so that we can investigate further.
creator: shailesh.260382

title: video touch (double tap?) control - seek forward/rewind - for firefox in linux/windows tablet
content:
Hello, I use ubuntu on my M$ surface go2 tablet, and I wonder, if it's possible to enable video touch control (HTML5 player) on video sites other than youtube, like I have in android or chromeOS. On Android this option works always. On ChromeOS doesn't work in privacy mode (no idea why, there is no addons or extensions, just pure firefox.

I know ther is option in PiP option, but is it possible to use just double tap on screen instead of small buttons? (now double tap turns on and off full screen).
creator: robot11

title: CORS call without ERROR but does not generate cookie
content:
NO ERROR IN CONSOLE; COOKIES, ETC... BUT NOT CREATE COOKIE SSO... IN CHROME YES. NO DETAILS IN BROWSER OF ERROR FOR COOKIE.

DEFAULT CONFIG OF SECURITY in BROWSER. We dont know why the cookie does not exist.

Thanks

SOLVED: The problem is the config default of firefox https://support.mozilla.org/es/kb/presentando-proteccion-total-de-cookies-en-modo-es?as=u&utm_source=inproduct

It is a problem for us and SSO that uses other domain... ufff Block cookie SSO

only works if you put a exeption in config browser

title: Some .exe setup files won't open when downloaded by Firefox but work fine when grabbed by Edge
content:
Hello! I'm on Windows 11 and when trying to update QBittorrent, if I download the last setup.exe from it's official source with Firefox, the file won't open. No error message, no crash, nothing. No amount of double click or "run as admin" will get it to budge. I've had the problem with the last three versions of QBittorrent.

However, when I download the same .exe from the same website with Microsoft Edge, it runs like a charm and I'm able to update QBittorent.

What's weird is that it's not even consistent; I always get that bug with QBittorrent but the other .exe files I downloaded run just fine. I only use Windows Defender for malware protection and it doesn't see the QBittorrent file as a menace. I tried downloading the file to another location than my desktop but the issue persists.

Is there something I can do to fix this?

Have a nice day!
creator: TheCannibalPony

title: Your Directions for adding apps and other items does not match my version of Firefox

title: PR_END_OF_FILE_ERROR
